title: Donald Trump says he has been indicted again
description: The former president says he has been summoned to appear in court in Miami on Tuesday.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Horror at the playground' as British girl stabbed
description: Most of Friday's papers lead on a British child, 3, being among those stabbed in a park in France.

title: Boris Johnson has Partygate inquiry findings ahead of report's publication
description: A committee is deciding whether the former PM purposely misled Parliament over lockdown-breaking parties in Downing Street.

title: Canadian Open: Rory McIlroy and Justin Rose agree on merger silence
description: Rory McIlroy says he and Justin Rose agreed not to speak about the shock three-way golf merger as they teed off in the first round of the Canadian Open.

title: West Ham trophy parade: Thousands gather to celebrate Europa Conference League win
description: The streets of east London were a sea of claret and blue on Thursday evening as thousands gathered for the West Ham trophy parade after their Europa Conference League victory.

title: Plaid Cymru: Rhun ap Iorwerth set to be new leader
description: A senior party source says no other members of the party's Senedd group will be standing.

title: French Open 2023: Karolina Muchova proving doctors wrong with run to first Grand Slam final
description: In 2022, an injury-laden Karolina Muchova was told her tennis career could be over. Now she is in her first Grand Slam final.

title: French Open 2023: Novak Djokovic takes on Carlos Alcaraz in Paris semi-finals
description: Novak Djokovic, the 22-time Grand Slam champion, and Spanish world number one Carlos Alcaraz meet in the French Open semi-finals on Friday.

title: Teen on e-bike dies after colliding with ambulance
description: Greater Manchester Police say the 15-year-old died after colliding with an ambulance.

title: West Ham trophy parade draws huge east London crowds
description: Crowds in east London celebrate West Ham football club's first major trophy for 43 years.

title: Rishi Sunak and Joe Biden announce green funding agreement
description: The new Atlantic Declaration between the UK and US "sets a new standard for economic cooperation", Rishi Sunak says.

title: HSBC withdraws mortgage deals for new borrowers
description: The bank said on Thursday it would temporarily pull new deals, indicating mortgage market pressures.

title: The Ashes: Steve Smith warns England over trying to Bazball Australia
description: Steve Smith warns England they have "not come up against us yet" after Australia's pace attack ripped through India on day two of the World Test Championship final.

title: Taurine may extend life and health, scientists find
description: Researchers say the nutrient may be an "elixir of life" but warn against buying it until more research is done.

title: Surbiton Trophy: Top seed Dan Evans shocked by Gabriel Diallo in second round
description: British number one Dan Evans' grass-court campaign takes an early blow with a second-round straight-set defeat by Gabriel Diallo in the Surbiton Trophy.

title: Odey Asset Management City probed as sexual harassment claims emerge
description: News of the investigation comes as found Mr Odey is accused of sexually harassing or assaulting 13 women.

title: Keely Hodgkinson: Briton ready to start outdoor season with a 'bang' at Paris Diamond League
description: Britain's Keely Hodgkinson says she is ready to begin her outdoor season with a "bang" at the Paris Diamond League on Friday.

title: World Test Championship final: Australia bowlers tear through India
description: Australia's bowlers put in a thunderous performance to rip through the India top order on day two of the World Test Championship final at The Oval.

title: Weekend hot weather alert escalated to amber
description: High temperatures from Friday could affect all ages and impact the health service, a UK agency says.

title: Glastonbury: Disposable vapes added to 'what not to bring' list
description: The festival extends its "reduce, reuse, recycle" slogan to "environmentally hazardous" e-cigarettes..

title: Sarah Jessica Parker to make West End debut with husband Matthew Broderick
description: The Sex and the City actress will star opposite her husband Matthew Broderick in Plaza Suite.

title: French Open 2023 results: Aryna Sabalenka loses to Karolina Muchova in Paris semi-finals
description: Karolina Muchova is one of lowest-ranked players to reach the French Open women's final with a thrilling win over second seed Aryna Sabalenka.

title: Ukraine war: Kyiv accuses Russia of shelling Kherson evacuations
description: Russian shelling kills at least one person as residents flee floods caused by the Ukraine dam breach.

title: Matt Hancock feared being pushed down tube escalator, court hears
description: Ex-health secretary Matt Hancock says he feared being pushed down an escalator by Geza Tarjanyi.

title: World Test Championship final: Virat Kohli out for 14 to 'unplayable' Mitchell Starc delivery
description: Watch as Australia pick up the huge wicket of Virat Kohli for 14 thanks to an unplayable delivery from Mitchell Starc on day two of the World Test Championship final at The Oval.

title: Kerri-Anne Donaldson: Former Britain's Got Talent contestant dies aged 38
description: Kerri-Anne Donaldson was part of the super-group Kings and Queens, who reached the 2014 semi-finals.

title: Lucy Letby: Babies died within 72 hours of nurse's text, jury told
description: The nurse denies attacking a baby to gain the attention of a doctor she allegedly "had a crush on".

title: Porthmadog: Police officer under criminal investigation after punch video
description: The officer was filmed seemingly hitting a man nine times in Porthmadog.

title: French Open 2023 results: Miyu Kato wins mixed doubles title after disqualification from women's event
description: Japan's Miyu Kato wins the French Open mixed doubles title four days after what she calls an "unjust" disqualification from the women's event.

title: Rammstein fan Shelby Lynn alleges she was groomed for sex
description: Shelby Lynn's allegations triggered a wave of sexual misconduct allegations that the band denies.

title: How Delhi copes with toxic air pollution
description: As wildfires rage in Canada, a view from one of the most polluted cities in the world.

title: Religious US broadcaster Pat Robertson dies at 93
description: The evangelical Christian ran for president and helped put religion at the heart of Republican politics.

title: Air quality: How to protect yourself from Canada wildfire smoke
description: With toxic air quality in parts of North America likely to persist, here's what you can do to stay safe.

title: El Niño planet-warming weather phase has begun
description: Storms, droughts and record high temperatures lie ahead as US scientists confirm that El Niño has arrived.

title: Piers Morgan 'injected' information into Prince Harry stories, court told
description: The Mirror's former royal correspondent gives evidence in Prince Harry's hacking court claim.

title: Sgt Matiu Ratana: Jury fires gun allegedly used to kill Met sergeant
description: Jurors are allowed to fire in court an antique revolver used to allegedly murder Sgt Matiu Ratana.

title: 'He was destined to reach the top' - the making of Mac Allister
description: From the streets of Argentina to the Premier League and World Cup glory - the story of Liverpool's new signing Alexis Mac Allister.

title: Banks accused of 'measly' interest rates on savings
description: MPs criticise banks as instant access savings rates sit well below the Bank of England base rate.

title: Man City v Inter Milan: Noel Gallagher on the Champions League final and why this has been Pep Guardiola's greatest season
description: Famous Manchester City fan Noel Gallagher tells BBC Sport about how he has annoyed Pep Guardiola at the end of his Treble bid - and why this has been the Spaniard's greatest season.

title: North America smoke: Is climate change fuelling wildfires?
description: Smoke from wildfires has enveloped Toronto and New York. We look at the role of a changing climate.

title: Strictly's Amy Dowden gives update as cancer treatment begins
description: Stars are wishing the Strictly dancer well as she starts treatment for grade three breast cancer.

title: Europa Conference League final: West Ham boss David Moyes celebrates in style after win
description: West Ham manager David Moyes shows off his dancing skills as he celebrates in the dressing room after the Europa Conference League triumph.

title: West Ham to hold Europa Conference League victory parade in East London
description: West Ham will celebrate their Europa Conference League triumph with an open-top bus parade in east London.

title: Boy who died in school incident named as Hamdan Aslam
description: The 14-year-old died in hospital after an incident at St Kentigern's Academy in West Lothian on Tuesday.

title: Alexis Mac Allister: Liverpool sign Brighton & Argentina midfielder for £55m
description: Liverpool complete a £55m deal to sign midfielder Alexis Mac Allister from Brighton on a five-year contract.

title: Lords debate Illegal Migration Bill until 4am
description: The measures face strong opposition from peers, as they debated potential changes to the bill until the early hours.

title: Declan Rice: West Ham United captain has 'heart' set on leaving after Europa Conference League title
description: Chairman David Sullivan says captain Declan Rice is likely to have played his last game for West Ham after being "promised" he could leave this summer.

title: Men rescued after inflatable duck drifts offshore
description: A paddleboarder helped three men drifting out to sea on the giant duck get back to shore.

title: France stabbing: Children attacked by knifeman in Annecy park
description: Children among several stabbed in attack in south-eastern France - interior minister

title: Busy escalator in South Korea suddenly changes direction
description: People were thrown to the floor and others tried to escape over the sides of the escalator.

title: Every home burglary scene now attended by officers, say police chiefs
description: The National Police Chiefs' Council says it met its target to improve domestic burglary responses.

title: Alexander Kareem: £20,000 reward offered in mistaken identity murder
description: Aspiring computer scientist Alexander Kareem, 20, was shot in Shepherds Bush in 2020.

title: Green Party MP Caroline Lucas to stand down at next election
description: The first ever Green MP says her role meant she had struggled to focus on climate issues.

title: NBA Finals: Denver Nuggets beat Miami Heat 109-94 to take 2-1 lead
description: The Denver Nuggets win 109-94 at the Miami Heat to move 2-1 up in the best-of-seven NBA Finals.

title: Oonagh Cousins: Great Britain rower forced to retire with long Covid, but at peace with decision
description: Great Britain rower Oonagh Cousins has retired from the sport because of the lasting effects of long Covid, but she's at peace after the illness turned her life "upside down".

title: Ukraine war: Deserters risk death fleeing to Romania
description: Men desperate to avoid serving in the army are crossing the mountainous Romanian border to escape.

title: Australia: Watch moment trapped humpback whale is cut free
description: A 10m humpback whale has been rescued after becoming entangled in a shark net off Australia’s Gold Coast.

title: LGBT+: Metropolitan Police chief apologises to Peter Tatchell over past failings
description: The Peter Tatchell Foundation wants all police chiefs to apologise for "decades-long victimisation".

title: Killing Eve star Jodie Comer halts Broadway show due to wildfire smoke
description: Jodie Comer left the stage saying she had trouble breathing due to poor air caused by Canada fires.

title: Possible charges loom for Donald Trump over classified documents
description: US media report the ex-president has been notified of a probe, suggesting he could soon face charges.

title: Sudan conflict: What to do with the dead bodies in Khartoum
description: Some Khartoum residents have become accidental undertakers to stop corpses being left on the streets.

title: Ukraine dam: Floods devastate tracts of rich farmland
description: The long-term consequences for agriculture will be severe in one of Ukraine's most fertile areas.

title: Love Island: Do ITV show's new audio descriptions go far enough?
description: Blind and visually impaired fans say the introduction by the ITV dating show is the "first step".

title: Why Singapore is the only place in the world selling lab-grown meat
description: US-based Eat Just says its product is ethical, clean and green but scientists say it may just be a novelty.

title: NHS struggling to provide safe cancer care, say senior doctors
description: Staff shortages are driving up waiting lists in all four UK nations, the Royal College of Radiologists says.
